text:
Hello, I'm new here, that wanted to say Hi to everyone.
Im looking for some explanation regarding some API Blog post functionality - and more strictly - regarding transferring widgets data using API.
I have a source post with widgets definition and creating a new blog post with same widgets data.
The source post and destination post has exactly same widget data (body) definition but when editing destination post i see widgets doesnt have those data.

As a example adding a structure of one widget from source and destination post.
Can someone help and explain why destination post in GUI not showing a body data ?

Thanks a lot

Hi <@UFBNA9K9A> - Thank you for that. I found this with the ERD for relationships but it didn't resolve my query. I am new to our instance of HubSpot and I'm trying to get an understanding of how our Contact Properties relate to Workflows. Specifically, which properties are used most often for enrolling contacts in workflows.

I imagine there's some combination of contact properties
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/v2/get_contacts_properties>

and something in the workflows API, potentially

potentially something here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/v3/get_workflows>

which would allow our data team to create some diagram showing which Contact Properties are used in workflows.

My end goal is to have something in a data viz tool like Tableau so I can understand which properties are in use and which exist but are relics (with inactive forms, etc).

Is that something that's possible?
